final_result:
detect_number(image_0, 0).
detect_number(image_1, 1).
detect_number(image_2, 2).
detect_number(image_3, 3).
detect_number(image_4, 4).
detect_number(image_5, 5).
detect_number(image_6, 6).
detect_number(image_7, 7).
detect_number(image_8, 8).
detect_number(image_9, 9).
detect_operator(image_plus, +).
detect_operator(image_minus, -).
detect_operator(image_multiply, *).
detect_operator(image_divide, /).
detect_all([N], [N2]) :- 
 detect_number(N, N2).
detect_all([N,O|T], [N2,O2|T2]) :- 
 detect_number(N, N2), 
 detect_operator(O, O2), 
 detect_all(T, T2).
almost_equal(X, Y) :- 
 ground(Y), 
 abs(X - Y) < 0.0001.
almost_equal(X, Y) :- 
 var(Y), 
 Y is float(X).
expression(Images, Result) :- 
 detect_all(Images, Symbols), 
 parse(Symbols, Result).
parse([N], R) :- 
 almost_equal(N, R).
parse([N1, +, N2], R) :-
    almost_equal(N1 + N2, R).
parse([N1, -, N2], R) :-
    almost_equal(N1 - N2, R).
parse([N1, *, N2], R) :-
    almost_equal(N1 * N2, R).
parse([N1, /, N2], R) :-
    almost_equal(N1 / N2, R).
parse([N1, Op, N2|Rest], R) :-
    parse([N1, Op, N2], Temp),
    parse([Temp|Rest], R).
query(expression([image_2, image_divide, image_3, image_plus, image_3, image_minus, image_2, image_multiply, image_7], X)).
final_report: The generated code is syntactically valid and follows the structure of the original code, but it simplifies the parsing logic by handling binary operations directly. This change leads to incorrect results for complex expressions. The original code correctly handles operator precedence and complex expressions like '2 / (3 + 3) - 2 * 7', resulting in -10.333, while the generated code produces 11.666, which is incorrect. The generated code fails to maintain the original's handling of operator precedence and nested expressions.
